unnormalised: The big news, though, is the acquisition of some small AI startup (details still fuzzy, gotta dig around). Apparently, this deal is worth around Rs. 600 crore. unnormalised: However, not all sunshine and roses. Their employee attrition rate is still hovering around 20%, which is pretty high. Hiring ramp up will require approx. 4000-5000 new devs in Q4 alone, and finding qualified talent, especially with expertise in Python, Java, and cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, is proving difficult. They're supposedly offering salaries around Rs. 10 LPA for freshers, which seems competitive, but still... the grind is real.
